richTextContent.insert: Apex Exceptions Over Time, By Type
Investigate Details by Day - Select an Exception Type:

After selecting a class and date, you will have a timestamp and a stack trace detail to report to the relevant class or method owner to investigate further.  If you do not know who owns this code in the codebase, contain the person listed as the Last Modified By on the Apex Class Detail page in Setup.

The table above is limited to return 100 rows. You can edit the table using the 'Advanced Query Editor' and changed the limit clause at the end of the query to more than 100.  However, it is important to tackle issues on a class-by-class basis.

title.subtitleLabel: Select a Date on the chart below and a Class Name Error Count on the table on the left (click on the number rather than the class name) to investigate that specific stack trace in the table below.

title.label: Contention Leaders
title.subtitleLabel: Exceptions that indicate the org is under stress due to competing, long-running or intensive operations.
